title: This font used for company branding - Need to identify & hoping it was not specially created
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724102009im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Unknown%20Font_4048.jpg)

This font is used for company branding. I need to identify it and am hoping it was not created especially for them.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Unknown Font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724102009/http:/typophile.com/files/Unknown%20Font_1.jpg) | 5.67 KB |
author: webeagley

comments.content: This font used for company branding - Need to identify & hoping it was not specially created

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724102009im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PAPAS_5168.jpg)
  
It looks like the designer started out with ITC Stone Sans Bold, expanded it horizontally, and customized the bowls on the **P** s and the crossbars on the **A** s.
Hmm, and as a result of expanding the curves of the S now appear far too angular. Especially when compared with the P which has been made rounder after being expanded. Sad …
